title: PvP.net Kernel Patcher has stopped working
body: Ok, so I wanted to get into the game again. So I downloaded the installer and installed the game. But when I tried to open the client, it flashes "Pvp.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working". I've checked out previous threads before and did all the granting permissions stuff. I've ran it as an administrator and all. It doesn't seem to work. I would be very much grateful if the people here could help me! (please)

replies.body:
We will try to figure it out. Are you sure that your firewall is not interfearing in any way? Try disabling it for like 5 min. If you have W10 instaled (especially with creators update already applied), try to run installator as W7 application.

Remember that checking box "run this application as administrator" is not the same as rightclicking it and going for option "run as administrator" from drop down menu. Try both ways anyway. If those wont help we will try to run it with UAC dissabled in your system, thou i would hardly recommend checking firewall first.

U can try (just for the sake of it) going to "Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\system" there is our kernel, rightclick it and in program properties in compatibility bar check box "run as administrator" on the very bottom.

Thank you for taking the time for replying. I have tried all these solutions, sadly to no avail. I really hope I'm not the only one having the problem and I hope riot fixes this asap. I would really love to get back into the game. 
Also worth mentioning is that it used to work fine in the same system and the same os (literally 2 months ago).
Guys thank you for the support. The game works now and I am happy!

That PVP Patcher Kernel error means that your OS doesn't have the proper permissions settings in place and the League client isn't able to pull the files it needs to launch. Double check those settings by following the steps in this [**permissions guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) and you should be good to go!

I can see some of NA players are having similar issues, so maybe (and fortunatly for everyone) solution would be to just wait this time? If those are some problems on RIOT's end then there is nothing one could do. Anyway if things wont get better soon i will try to find some other solution.
